definition: to make one's home in/to reside in/to inhabit
to reside/to imply/to contain/residence
variant of 寓[yu4]
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju

sentences.english: Primitive tribes live in the Amazon River basin.
sentences.chinese: 原始部落寓居在亚马逊河盆地。

sentences.english: Each kingdom without inhabitant, a person strings strings and conformity conformity.
sentences.chinese: 相爱的国家里没有人寓居，一个人恍恍又惚惚。

sentences.english: She soon picked up French when she went to live in France.
sentences.chinese: 她到法国寓居后很快就学会了法语。

sentences.english: Poor sanitation conditions where they live.
sentences.chinese: 他们寓居环境卫生条件差。

sentences.english: This world is sweet, --I do not want to die. I wish to dwell in the ever-living life of Man.
sentences.chinese: 我希望寓居在永生的人类生活中。

sentences.english: But this was certainly where the man lived.
sentences.chinese: 但是这显然是那个人寓居的地方。
自己们与动物生活寓居。

sentences.english: The building must be for office-using, not for living.
sentences.chinese: 必定要供是办公楼，不能为官用寓居。

sentences.english: No one living room for years away, leaving the kitchen, rice also hot soup.
sentences.chinese: 多年无人寓居的房间一干二净，厨房里，汤饭还热着。

sentences.english: Their habitancy sanitation condition is bad.
sentences.chinese: 他们寓居环境卫生条件差。

sentences.english: This is the room in which he lives.
Austen frequently visited London and lived in Bath for years.
sentences.chinese: 奥斯汀频繁造访伦敦并在巴斯寓居多年。

sentences.english: The North American view is vast, with large spaces of unpopulated land.
sentences.chinese: 美国的观念是宏大的，与无人寓居的大片土地空间。

definition: to live in a foreign place/to live somewhere as a guest
to choose a home
to lead a quiet and peaceful life in retirement/to stay home with nothing to do/to lead a solitary life
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
former home
to move (from one residence to another)
former residence/one's original home
to live in seclusion
to live in seclusion
to migrate/to move house
(of officials in imperial China) to live in banishment
to register as domiciled in another land/naturalization
one's office/place where one holds a post
dwelling
to migrate/to move to a new place of residence
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
